DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Administered Radiation Field Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the radiation field.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to radiation therapy administered to a patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The area of the body exposed to radiation during radiation therapy._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.: Referring to lymphocytes, a type of white blood cell. Also refers to tissue in which lymphocytes develop.: Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Nodal; of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.: Any demarcated area of the Earth; may be determined by both natural and human boundaries.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
Referring to lymphocytes, a type of white blood cell. Also refers to tissue in which lymphocytes develop.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.
An area or portion of something with more or less definite boundaries designed or specified according to some established biological, administrative, economic, demographic, etc. criteria.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.: The entire physical structure of an organism.  It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.: A type of external beam radiation therapy in which the radiation is delivered slice-by-slice, providing sequential delivery of radiation to different parts of the tumor. This method differs from other forms of radiation therapy in which the entire tumor volume is irradiated at one time.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
The entire physical structure of an organism. It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.

A type of external beam radiation therapy in which the radiation is delivered slice-by-slice, providing sequential delivery of radiation to different parts of the tumor. This method differs from other forms of radiation therapy in which the entire tumor volume is irradiated at one time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.: The entire physical structure of an organism.  It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
The entire physical structure of an organism. It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to, involving, or affecting the thorax and abdomen.: Named areas of the body.

Concepts.definition: Relating to, involving, or affecting the thorax and abdomen.

PermissibleValues.value: Total body by intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.: The entire physical structure of an organism. It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
The entire physical structure of an organism. It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.

An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The area of the body exposed to radiation during radiation therapy.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: The area of the body exposed to radiation during radiation therapy.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: . Added PV "Total body by intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT)" for form 2402. AK 11/16/16
